alert.note: Alert for Marion (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 12:51PM CDT until July 02 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Marion County in northwestern Alabama... * Until 130 PM CDT. * At 1251 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hamilton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Haleyville, Brilliant, Lake Buttahatchee, Brinn, Twin, Marion County Public Lake, Pearces Mill, Rankin Fite Airport, Piney Grove and Pikeville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
